security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic brand guidelines skill for applying visual styling to artifacts. No security vulnerabilities detected. The skill contains only configuration data and styling guidance with no executable code, system access, or data processing concerns.

content.value_statement: Apply Anthropic's official brand identity to visual artifacts with accurate colors, typography, and design standards. Ensures consistent brand presentation across documents, presentations, and visual content.
actual_capabilities: Apply Anthropic's official color palette to artifacts
Apply Anthropic-approved typography (Poppins for headings, Lora for body)
Set brand-compliant backgrounds and text colors
Apply accent colors (orange, blue, green) to visual elements
Maintain visual hierarchy with brand-approved styling
limitations: Requires pre-installed Poppins and Lora fonts for optimal results (falls back to Arial/Georgia)
Primarily designed for document and presentation artifacts
Color application may vary slightly across different rendering engines
Does not include logo guidelines or detailed brand strategy documentation
Limited to styling existing artifacts (does not create new content from scratch)

use_cases.title: Presentation Styling
use_cases.description: Apply Anthropic brand colors and typography to PowerPoint or PDF presentations for consistent visual identity
use_cases.target_user: Marketing, Sales, and Product teams creating presentation materials

use_cases.title: Document Formatting
use_cases.description: Style technical documentation, whitepapers, or case studies with official Anthropic branding

use_cases.title: Visual Asset Design
use_cases.description: Create infographics, diagrams, and visual content that matches Anthropic's brand identity

use_cases.title: Internal Communications
use_cases.description: Format internal memos, announcements, and materials with consistent brand styling

prompt_templates.title: Basic Brand Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's official brand styling to this [artifact type]. Use the primary dark color (#141413) for text and the orange accent (#d97757) for highlights.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to quickly apply brand colors to an existing artifact

prompt_templates.title: Full Brand Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply complete Anthropic brand guidelines to this [document/presentation]: use Poppins font for all headings (24pt+), Lora for body text, dark background with light text, and orange/blue/green accents for visual elements.
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs comprehensive brand application across all design elements

prompt_templates.title: Accent Color Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's accent color palette to highlight key sections: use orange (#d97757) for primary highlights, blue (#6a9bcc) for secondary, and green (#788c5d) for tertiary elements.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to add visual hierarchy using brand accent colors

output_examples.input: Document with generic colors and fonts
output_examples.output: Styled document with Anthropic dark background (#141413), light text (#faf9f5), Poppins headings, Lora body text, and orange accent elements
Branded presentation with consistent color scheme, typography hierarchy, and accent color accents across all slides
Visually cohesive infographic using official Anthropic color palette with proper contrast and visual hierarchy

best_practices: Always use the dark color (#141413) for primary text on light backgrounds
Use the light color (#faf9f5) for text on dark backgrounds to maintain readability
Reserve orange (#d97757) for primary calls-to-action and key highlights
Apply Poppins font exclusively to headings 24pt and larger
Use Lora font for all body text and smaller typography
Test color contrast ratios to ensure WCAG accessibility compliance
Maintain consistent spacing and typography across all materials
Use mid-gray (#b0aea5) for secondary or tertiary text
Apply light gray (#e8e6dc) only for subtle background elements, not primary content
anti_patterns: Using custom colors outside the official palette
Applying Poppins font to body text (defeats hierarchy)
Using generic system fonts instead of Poppins/Lora
Placing light text on light backgrounds or dark on dark
Over-using orange accent color (should be reserved for key elements)
Mixing multiple competing typefaces beyond Poppins and Lora
Applying brand colors inconsistently across related materials

faq.question: Do I need to install Poppins and Lora fonts?
faq.answer: For best results, yes. However, the skill automatically falls back to Arial (headings) and Georgia (body) if custom fonts are unavailable. Pre-installation ensures optimal brand appearance.

faq.question: Can I use these colors in web design?
faq.answer: Yes. The RGB color values provided (#141413, #faf9f5, etc.) work across web, print, and digital formats. For web, convert to hex format (#141413) or use the RGB equivalents.

faq.question: What if I need to modify the colors slightly?
faq.answer: While the official palette should be used for brand consistency, minor adjustments for accessibility (e.g., slightly increased contrast) are acceptable with approval from brand guidelines stakeholders.

faq.question: Are there logo usage guidelines included?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on color and typography standards. For detailed logo usage, spacing, and placement guidelines, refer to the complete Anthropic brand guidelines documentation.

faq.question: How do I ensure WCAG compliance with these colors?
faq.answer: Test color combinations using accessibility checkers. The light/dark pairing (#faf9f5 on #141413) meets WCAG AA standards. Always verify custom combinations.

dependencies: System fonts: Poppins, Lora (optional, with automatic fallbacks)
permissions_needed: Write access to generate styled outputs
technical_requirements.estimated_complexity: Low - straightforward color and font application without complex logic
